ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
numpy:
- '1.26'
python_min:
- '3.9'
tk:
- '8.6'
vtk:
- 9.3.0

about.summary:
EVTK (Export VTK) package allows exporting data to binary VTK files for
visualization and data analysis with any of the visualization packages that
support VTK files, e.g. Paraview, VisIt and Mayavi. EVTK does not depend on
any external library (e.g. VTK), so it is easy to install in different
systems.

EVTK (Export VTK) package allows exporting data to binary VTK files for
visualization and data analysis with any of the visualization packages that
support VTK files, e.g. Paraview, VisIt and Mayavi. EVTK does not depend on
any external library (e.g. VTK), so it is easy to install in different
systems.

name: pyevtk
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pyevtk" %}
{% set version = "1.6.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 1f6be7876a3a005c8258861551da4fe7e44ff1a2e7ff2a93d6dc51deedfda5f4

build:
  number: 1
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps
  noarch: python

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - numpy
    - setuptools
    - versioneer
    - pytest-runner

  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - numpy

test:
  requires:
    - pytest
    - python {{ python_min }}
  source_files:
    - examples/*.py
    - tests/*.py
  commands:
    - pytest tests/dummy.py
about:
  home: https://github.com/pyscience-projects/pyevtk
  license: BSD-2-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: |
    EVTK (Export VTK) package allows exporting data to binary VTK files for
    visualization and data analysis with any of the visualization packages that
    support VTK files, e.g. Paraview, VisIt and Mayavi. EVTK does not depend on
    any external library (e.g. VTK), so it is easy to install in different
    systems.
  dev_url: https://github.com/paulo-herrera/PyEVTK

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - xylar
    - MuellerSeb
